conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph and understand the motion of the particle.
The graph is symmetric about the dashed line.
Symmetry indicates the particle's velocity changes in a specific pattern.
The graph is symmetric about the vertical line passing through the minimum point.
Time taken to reach minimum velocity is the same as time taken to return to initial velocity after minimum.
Particle starts with positive velocity, decreases to minimum, then increases back to initial velocity.
Particle is moving in a straight line and direction of motion changes at minimum velocity.
Particle passes through a certain position three times, indicating two points in time where particle is at same position as start.
Particle returns to starting position after completing a full cycle of motion.
Full cycle of motion is from start, to minimum, and back to start.
Time taken for particle to go from start to minimum and back to start is 2t.
Since particle passes through starting position three times in time interval 0 to t1, time t1 must be such that particle has completed at least one full cycle and part of next cycle.
If t1 = 3t, particle will have completed one full cycle and be at starting position again.
Since problem states particle passes through starting position three times, time t1 must be such that particle has completed two full cycles and is on way to starting position for third time.
This implies t1 = 4t.
Possible scenario is particle completes two full cycles and is on way to starting position for third time.
Time t1 must be such that particle has completed two full cycles and is on way to starting position for third time.
Time t1 is four times the time it takes to reach minimum velocity.
Final answer is t1 = 4t.
Problem does not specify exact value of t.
General form of answer is that time t1 is four times the time it takes to reach minimum velocity.
Specific value of t is not given.
Answer in terms of t is t1 = 4t.
